intro: Weinmannia cochensis var. puracensis, commonly known as the Puracén Puracén, is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypresses and related conifers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered cones. It typically grows in humid, montane forests at elevations between 1,200 and 2,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
